jparsec.ephem

Class RiseSetTransit

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.RiseSetTransit

  • public class RiseSetTransit
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for calculation of the rise, set and transit instants. These events can be obtained referred to any of the predefined twilight events.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RiseSetTransit.EVENT
      The set of possible events.
      static class  RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT
      The set of twilights to calculate (types of rise/set events).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALWAYS_BELOW_HORIZON
      Constant ID for a never visible object, which has no rise or set times.
      static int CIRCUMPOLAR
      Constant ID for a circumpolar object, which has no rise or set times.
      static int NO_RISE_SET_TRANSIT
      This value is used for objects that have no rise, set, or transit in a given date in local time, when the events calculated are those referred to current date.

    • Field Detail

      • CIRCUMPOLAR

        public static final int CIRCUMPOLAR
        Constant ID for a circumpolar object, which has no rise or set times. Please note that for astronomical twilights (for instance) calculations, this would mean that the object never reaches a geometric elevation of -18 degrees, but could have other rise/set events like the usual astronomical one.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALWAYS_BELOW_HORIZON

        public static final int ALWAYS_BELOW_HORIZON
        Constant ID for a never visible object, which has no rise or set times.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_RISE_SET_TRANSIT

        public static final int NO_RISE_SET_TRANSIT
        This value is used for objects that have no rise, set, or transit in a given date in local time, when the events calculated are those referred to current date.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • horizonDepression

        public static double horizonDepression(ObserverElement obs,
                       EphemerisElement eph)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Gets the angle of depression of the horizon. An object will be just in the geometric horizon when it's elevation is equal to minus this value. This correction can modify the time of the events by some minutes.
        Parameters:
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        The angle in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • obtainCurrentOrNextRiseSetTransit

        public static EphemElement obtainCurrentOrNextRiseSetTransit(TimeElement time,
                                             ObserverElement obs,
                                             EphemerisElement eph,
                                             EphemElement ephem_elem,
                                             RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT twilight_event)
                                                      throws JPARSECException
        Provides rise, set, and transit times correcting for the movement of the object. For objects above the horizon, the result is refered to the current day, otherwise they will be the next rise, set, and transit events.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        ephem_elem - Ephem object with the position of the source.
        twilight_event - Twilight/horizon event ID to calculate.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing full ephemeris data. The rise, set, transit times will be given in the corresponding fields as Julian days, which could have special values given as constants in this class if the object is circumpolar or is never above the horizon.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • obtainNextRiseSetTransit

        public static EphemElement obtainNextRiseSetTransit(TimeElement time,
                                    ObserverElement obs,
                                    EphemerisElement eph,
                                    EphemElement ephem_elem,
                                    RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT twilight_event)
                                             throws JPARSECException
        Provides next rise, set, and transit times correcting for the movement of the object.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        ephem_elem - Ephem object with the position of the source.
        twilight_event - Twilight/horizon event ID to calculate.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing full ephemeris data. The rise, set, transit times will be given in the corresponding fields as Julian days, which could have special values given as constants in this class if the object is circumpolar or is never above the horizon.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

        public static EphemElement obtainCurrentRiseSetTransit(TimeElement time,
                                       ObserverElement obs,
                                       EphemerisElement eph,
                                       EphemElement ephem_elem,
                                       RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT twilight_event)
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Provides current (refered to the actual day) rise, set, and transit times correcting for the movement of the object.

        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        ephem_elem - Ephem object with the position of the source.
        twilight_event - Twilight/horizon event ID to calculate.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing full ephemeris data. The rise, set, transit times will be given in the corresponding fields as Julian days, which could have special values given as constants in this class if the object is circumpolar or is never above the horizon.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.
